text: Anuradha Sriram Anuradha Sriram (9 July 1970) is an Indian Carnatic vocalist and film playback singer. Best known for her work in Tamil also worked in a few projects in other South Indian language films.Anuradha has recorded over 3000 songs. She has also recorded songs for many non-film albums, tele-series, devotionals and classical collaborations. Anuradha debuted as a singer with the group song "Malarodu Malaringu" composed by A. R. Rahman for the film Bombay (1995). However, she shot to fame with her solo song "Anbendra Mazhayile" from the film Minsara Kanavu (1997), again composed by A. R. Rahman. Since then, Anuradha has recorded thousands of film songs for various prominent South Indian music composers such as Ilaiyaraja, Vidyasagar, Deva, Anu Malik, M. M. Keeravani, Sirpy, Hamsalekha, Ouseppachan, Mani Sharma, Koti, Mohan Sithara, Yuvan Shankar Raja, Harris Jayaraj and others. == Recorded film songs == This is only a partial list; Anuradha has sung over 3000 songs in Tamil, Kannada, Hindi, Telugu and Malayalam. == Tamil film songs == === 1990s === {| class="wikitable plainrowheaders" width="100%" textcolor:#000;" |- style="background:#b0e0e66; ! scope="col" width=5%|Year ! scope="col" width=23%|Film ! scope="col" width=23%|Song ! scope="col" width=15%|Composer(s) ! scope="col" width=10%|Writer(s) ! scope="col" width=20%|Co-artist(s) |- | rowspan="10"|1995 ! rowspan="2"|Bombay | "Malarodu Malaringu" | rowspan="2"|A.
